title: Impact of Economic Factors on OrganiGram Holdings Inc Stock Prices

content.section: 1. Relationship between interest rates and stock prices
content.text: Interest rates have a direct impact on the cost of borrowing for companies like OrganiGram Holdings Inc. When interest rates are low, companies can access cheap capital, which can lead to increased investments and expansion. This can positively affect stock prices as investors anticipate higher future earnings. Conversely, when interest rates rise, borrowing becomes more expensive, leading to reduced investment and potential decline in stock prices.

Interest rates also influence consumer spending patterns. When interest rates are low, borrowing costs decrease, making it more attractive for consumers to borrow and spend money on products and services. This increased consumer spending can have a positive impact on companies' revenues and profitability, potentially leading to higher stock prices for companies like OrganiGram Holdings Inc. On the other hand, high interest rates can discourage consumers from borrowing and spending, potentially leading to lower revenues and stock prices.

The relationship between inflation and interest rates is another important factor to consider. When inflation is high, central banks often increase interest rates to control inflationary pressures. Higher interest rates can make borrowing more expensive for companies, which can lead to decreased investments and potentially lower stock prices. Conversely, when inflation is low, central banks may lower interest rates, which can stimulate investment and potentially result in higher stock prices.

Interest rates also have an impact on overall market sentiment and investor behavior. When interest rates are low, investors may be more willing to take on risk and invest in stocks, as they seek higher returns compared to low-yielding fixed-income investments. This increased demand for stocks can contribute to higher stock prices for companies like OrganiGram Holdings Inc. Conversely, when interest rates are high, investors may be more inclined to invest in bonds and other fixed-income assets, potentially leading to lower demand for stocks and lower stock prices.

It is important to note that other external economic factors, such as the overall state of the economy, industry-specific trends, and geopolitical events, can also influence OrganiGram Holdings Inc stock prices. These factors, in combination with interest rates, determine the overall investment climate and market conditions, which can impact investor confidence and the perceived value of stocks.

(NASDAQ: OGI) (TSX: OGI), a leading licensed producer of cannabis, is pleased to unveil the preliminary results of its landmark clinical pharmacokinetic (PK) study conducted via the Product Development Collaboration (PDC) on its latest innovation, nanoemulsion technology.
